name: sbatch
description: sbatch  submits  a  batch script to SLURM.

parameterdefs.name: array
parameterdefs.description: Submit a job array, multiple jobs to be executed with identical parameters.

parameterdefs.name: account
parameterdefs.description: Charge resources used by this job to specified account.

parameterdefs.name: begin
parameterdefs.description: Submit  the  batch  script  to  the SLURM controller immediately, like normal, but tell the controller to defer the allocation of the job until the specified time.

parameterdefs.name: comment
parameterdefs.description: An arbitrary comment enclosed in double quotes if using spaces or some special characters.

parameterdefs.name: constraint
parameterdefs.description: Only nodes having features matching the job constraints will be used to satisfy the request.

parameterdefs.name: contiguous
parameterdefs.description: If set, then the allocated nodes must form a contiguous set.

parameterdefs.name: cores_per_socket
parameterdefs.description: Restrict node selection to nodes with at least the specified number of cores per socket.

parameterdefs.name: cpus_per_task
parameterdefs.description: Advise the SLURM controller that ensuing job steps will require ncpus  number  of  processors  per  task.

parameterdefs.name: dependency
parameterdefs.description: Defer  the  start  of  this  job until the specified dependencies have been satisfied.

parameterdefs.name: workdir
parameterdefs.description: Set  the working directory of the batch script before it is executed.

parameterdefs.name: error
parameterdefs.description: Instruct SLURM to connect the batch script standard error directly to the file name specified

parameterdefs.name: exclusive
parameterdefs.description: The job allocation can not share nodes with other running jobs.

parameterdefs.name: export
parameterdefs.description: Identify which environment variables are propagated to the batch job.

parameterdefs.name: export_file
parameterdefs.description: Export  environment  variables  defined in a filename or numerical file descriptor.

parameterdefs.name: nodefile
parameterdefs.description: List of nodes in a file

parameterdefs.name: get_user_env
parameterdefs.description: This  option  will  tell sbatch to retrieve the login environment variables for the user specified in the --uid option.
